plants.title: Monstera Deliciosa
plants.description: Monstera Deliciosa, also known as the Swiss Cheese Plant, is a popular choice for its striking split leaves that add a tropical touch to any space. It's relatively easy to care for and grows well in indirect light.

plants.title: Fiddle Leaf Fig
plants.description: The Fiddle Leaf Fig is an eye-catching plant with large, violin-shaped leaves. It's an elegant choice to bring a touch of nature indoors. It prefers bright, indirect light and regular watering.

plants.title: Snake Plant (Sansevieria)
plants.description: The Snake Plant is a hardy and low-maintenance plant known for its upright, sword-shaped leaves. It's an excellent air purifier and can thrive in low-light conditions, requiring minimal watering.

plants.title: ZZ Plant (Zamioculcas Zamiifolia)
plants.description: The ZZ Plant is valued for its glossy, dark green foliage and ability to tolerate low light and irregular watering. It's a great choice for beginners or for spaces with limited natural light.

plants.title: Spider Plant (Chlorophytum comosum)
plants.description: The Spider Plant is characterized by its long, arching leaves with white stripes. It's an adaptable plant that produces baby spider plants (spiderettes) and does well in various light conditions.

plants.title: Peace Lily (Spathiphyllum)
plants.description: The Peace Lily is a popular choice for its elegant white flowers and lush green leaves. It prefers medium to low light and can help purify indoor air.

plants.title: Pothos (Epipremnum aureum)
plants.description: Pothos, also known as Devil's Ivy, is a trailing vine with heart-shaped leaves. It's incredibly versatile, thriving in various light conditions and requiring minimal care.

plants.title: Rubber Plant (Ficus elastica)
plants.description: The Rubber Plant features large, glossy leaves that add a bold statement to indoor spaces. It prefers bright, indirect light and moderate watering.
